data.title: Church of England head resigns over abuse cover-up
data.description: LONDON — Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby resigned “in sorrow” on Tuesday, saying he had failed to ensure there was a proper investigation into allegations of abuse by a volunteer at Christian summer camps decades ago.

data.title: Driver rams his car into crowd in China, killing 35
data.description: Police say he was upset about his divorce

data.title: Israelis in Thailand urged to be vigilant
data.description: Israeli authorities have advised their nationals in Thailand to remain vigilant following reports that they might be targeted during the  Full Moon Party  on  Koh Phangan  this coming Friday, the Times of Israel reports.

data.title: Church of England head urged to quit over abuse cover-up
data.description: LONDON — Justin Welby, the Archbishop of Canterbury and spiritual leader of the global Anglican church, is facing mounting calls to resign over a report that his institution had covered up prolific abuse of boys and young men.

data.title: Driver kills 35 pedestrians in Chinese city
data.description: A hit-and-run attack at a sports centre in the southern Chinese city of Zhuhai killed 35 people and severely injured 43, local police said on Tuesday.

data.title: Foreigner blamed for Pattaya crash death
data.description: PATTAYA - A foreign woman has been arrested for crashing her car into a motorcycle, killing one person and injuring another.

data.title: Chinese illegals busted near Myanmar border
data.description: KANCHANABURI - Twenty foreigners — 18 Chinese men and two Lao women — have been arrested in Sangkhla Buri district for staying illegally in the country, police said on Tuesday.

data.title: Driver kills at least 35 pedestrians in Chinese city
data.description: Thirty-five people were killed and 43 others injured after a car drove into a group of people exercising outside a sports centre in the Chinese city of Zhuhai on Monday evening, the state broadcaster CCTV reported on Tuesday.

data.title: DHL International Multimodal Hub launched at Suvarnabhumi Airport
data.description: DHL Global Forwarding Thailand, the freight-specialist arm of DHL Group, has unveiled its new International Multimodal Hub, claiming it marks a significant advancement in the kingdom's logistics capabilities.

data.title: Opera to recall King Chulalongkorn’s royal visit to Europe in 1907
data.description: An opera at The Siam Society in Bangkok in late November will allow audiences to follow the footsteps of King Chulalongkorn’s second royal visit to Europe in 1907.

data.title: Adorable baby Phayre’s langur captures hearts online
data.description: The cute ‘doll-like’ young primate was spotted in Thung Yai Naresuan East Wildlife Sanctuary and shared on social media

data.title: illegal migrants caught heading for jobs in Malaysia
data.description: SONGKHLA - Twenty-four illegal migrants from Myanmar wanting to get jobs in Malaysia, a Thai driver and a Myanmar intermediary were arrested by police in Hat Yai district on Tuesday.

data.title: Extra public holidays next year approved
data.description: The cabinet has approved extra public holidays for next year and January 2026, declaring long-weekends to boost tourism and the overall economy.

data.title: Bangkok's annual light and digital-art festival back for seventh year
data.description: Festival returns to Phra Nakhon district, showcasing 36 light and digital-art installations

data.title: Police round up crypto-mining power thieves
data.description: Police and electricity authorities have raided buildings in Chachoengsao and Surat Thani provinces, arrested suspects and seized  cryptocurrency mining  machines that stole tens of millions of baht worth of  electricity .

data.title: 2 held for modifying power meters to run bitcoin mines in Surat Thani
data.description: Police track down suspects after Provincial Electricity Authority finds it has been defrauded out of approximately 10 million baht thanks to the tampering of meters in nine locations

data.title: Woman killed by elephant at kathin ceremony
data.description: A woman was killed and two other people seriously injured by an agitated young elephant during a merit ceremony in the northeastern province of Bueng Khan.

data.title: Driver kills at least 10 pedestrians in Chinese city
data.description: A car rammed into pedestrians at a sports centre in the southern Chinese city of Zhuhai, leaving more than 10 dead and injuring nearly 100, with the driver detained at the scene, according to media reports.

data.title: Cabinet okays 55bn baht for GHB’s ‘Happy Home, Happy Life’ project
data.description: The government bank will grant loans for new homes and for the refurbishment of old homes at low interest rates to help low-income earners

data.title: FXGT.com Launches Innovative FXGT App and Trader Platform
data.description: In an era where technology is reshaping the landscape of online trading, FXGT.com has officially launched two innovative products designed to enhance the trading journey for all users: the FXGT App and FXGT.com Trader. These tools exemplify the company’s commitment to providing a seamless, powerful, and secure trading environment that adapts to the needs of modern traders.

data.title: MINT Reports 19% Core Profit Growth for 9M24 Poised for Strong Q4 and 2024
data.description: Minor International Public Company Limited (MINT)  has announced core net profit of THB 5,514 million for the first nine months of 2024, a 19% year-on-year increase. Core EBITDA grew 11% year-on-year to THB 33,623 million, powered by a 9% rise in core revenue driven by outstanding performances in MINT’s hospitality and restaurant businesses. This strong growth was driven by effective revenue optimisation, resulting in increased ADR and RevPAR across MINT’s hotel portfolio, together with sustained cost discipline.

data.title: Bangkok’s congestion charge model to be ready in 6 months: Suriya
data.description: Transport Ministry eyes imposing congestion charges on motorists in the heart of the capital to reduce traffic, pollution and fund train projects

data.title: Losing EPL rights to have ‘no significant impact’: True Corp
data.description: After May 2025, EPL licence will be given to Jasmine International, which outbid True

data.title: Loy Krathong expected to draw 36% more flights than last year
data.description: Flight bookings to Thailand are expected to surge by 36% during the Loy Krathong festival, which falls on Friday, November 15, government deputy spokesman Karom Polpornklang said on Monday.

data.title: Anger over Department of Lands’ decision on Khao Kradong, Buriram
data.description: Decision comes despite Supreme Court ruling that these lands belong to SRT; Department of Lands clarifies situation

data.title: Thais to enjoy 3 long weekends in 2025 in tourism push
data.description: The government has announced three extra public holidays next year to support the ‘Amazing Thailand Grand Tourism and Sports Year’ initiative

data.title: Bodyslam scraps 2 shows after ‘Toon’ surgery
data.description: The famous rock band Bodyslam has cancelled two shows this week as lead singer Artiwara “Toon” Kongmalai is recovering from minor surgery carried out on Sunday.

data.title: Teaching English in Bangkok: Is This the Right City for You?
data.description: Bangkok is a city that truly stands out – a colourful mix of ancient temples, bustling markets, and glittering skyscrapers. As Thailand’s vibrant capital, it’s a magnet for travellers, expats, and anyone in search of new experiences. But beyond the temples and street food, Bangkok is also a top choice for people looking to teach English abroad. With a high demand for English teachers, modern amenities, and a wide range of job opportunities, the city has become a favourite destination for aspiring teachers.

data.title: Boghossian’s High Jewellery Tribute to Bangkok’s Grand Palace
data.description: Renowned Swiss jeweller Boghossian has chosen Bangkok for the debut of its “Palace Voyages” high jewellery collection in Thailand. From 11 to 13 November 2024, the Mandarin Oriental Bangkok will host a Luncheon and Private Showcase, unveiling 13 exquisite pieces that capture the enchanting spirit of some of the world’s most celebrated palaces, including Thailand’s Grand Palace, Beijing’s Qianlong Palace, and England’s Brighton Pavilion.

data.title: Sittra’s legal troubles mount as police nab close associates
data.description: CSD police arrest couple for allegedly helping him talk EuroMillions winner into transferring 39 million baht to them

data.title: Forestry employee arrested for rosewood theft
data.description: A forestry employee has been arrested in Udon Thani after intruders attacked staff and  stole 19 phayung logs  and two guns from a  forest conservation unit  in Sakon Nakhon province on Saturday.

data.title: Bangkok set to dazzle with light extravaganzas from Saturday
data.description: 14 sites across the city are set to light up with stunning shows and fireworks for a whole month from Saturday as part of the Thailand Winter Festivals

data.title: “Having breakfast” yields unimaginable benefits as “Nutrilite” is hoping to nurture healthy habits so Thais can age well
data.description: Do you know that average life expectancy in Thailand is increasing? 73 is the average life expectancy of Thai men while 79 is the latest average life expectancy for Thai women. Having a long life, nonetheless, is not enough as one should have a long and healthy life.

data.title: Lawyer Sittra case highlights inequality in Thai justice system
data.description: Only 5% of police complaints lead to legal action, with wealthier victims far more likely to see their cases investigated

data.title: Forest policeman arrested for rosewood theft
data.description: A former  forestry policeman  has been arrested in Udon Thani after intruders attacked staff and stole 19 phayung logs  and two guns from a  forest conservation unit  in Sakon Nakhon province on Saturday.

data.title: BMI being phased out in favour of BRI
data.description: DEAR DOCTORS:  I
